required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Kinesio Taping in Patellofemoral Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Kinesio Taping in Painful and Neuromuscular Performance of Patients With Patellofemoral Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

clinical_study.source: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to analyze the immediate effects and 72 hours after application of the Kinesio Taping (KT) in the electromyographic activity of the vastus medialis oblique (VMO) and vastus lateralis (VL), the isokinetic performance of the quadriceps and referred pain of subjects with PFPS. The volunteers will be randomly assigned to one of the three groups and perform one of the protocols: control - remain at rest; KT - application of Kinesio Taping with tension in the VMO region; placebo - application of Kinesio Taping without tension, in the same region. All volunteers will be submitted to the evaluation of pain intensity, the electromyographic activity of the VMO and VL and dynamometric parameters in 3 times: before the application of KT, immediately after the application of KT and after 72h of application. Average effect estimates (differences between groups) for all variables will be calculated using the mixed model ANOVA with a significance level of 5% (p ≤ 0.05).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in electromyographic at one hour and three days
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of onset electromyographic activity of Vastus Medialis Obliquus relative to Vastus Lateralis

arm_group.description: Apply the Kinesio Taping with tension in the vatus mediallis
Apply the Kinesio Taping without tension in the vatus mediallis

intervention.description: Application of the Kinesio Taping with tension in the vatus mediallis muscle.
Application of the Kinesio Taping without tension in the vatus mediallis muscle.

overall_official.affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

facility.name: Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte
